Package packbuilding

Class Building

java.lang.Object
packbuilding.Building
public class Building
extends java.lang.Object
Represents a set of light bulbs in a building.
Version:
1
Author:
Oihan Irastorza

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Building()
    Building class constructor.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addLightBulb​(LightBulb lightbulb)
    Adds the light bulb passed by parameter to the light bulb list.
    double currentConsumption()
    Returns the sum of energy consumption of all the light bulbs in the building.
    double maximumConsumption()
    Returns the sum of maximum energy consumption of all light bulbs in the building by turning on every light bulb.
    LightBulb obtainLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID)
    Returns the light bulb with the ID passed by parameter
    void printBulbs()
    Prints on standard output the information of every light bulb in the array.
    void printWetPlaceBulbs()
    Prints every light bulb that can be placed in wet places.
    void sort()
    Sorts the light bulb list by bulb identifier.
    void turnOffLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID)
    Tries to turn off the light bulb with the identifier passed by parameter.
    void turnOnLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID)
    Tries to turn on the light bulb with the identifier passed by parameter.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Building

      public Building()
      Building class constructor. Initializes the ligh bulb ArrayList.

  • Method Details

    • turnOnLightBulb

      public void turnOnLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID) throws UnknownIdentifierException, AlreadyOnException
      Tries to turn on the light bulb with the identifier passed by parameter.
      Parameters:
      ID - light bulb identifier
      Throws:
      UnknownIdentifierException - if the ID passed by parameter does not match any ID in the light bulb list
      AlreadyOnException - if the light bulb is already on

    • turnOffLightBulb

      public void turnOffLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID) throws UnknownIdentifierException, AlreadyOffException
      Tries to turn off the light bulb with the identifier passed by parameter.
      Parameters:
      ID - light bulb identifier
      Throws:
      UnknownIdentifierException - if the ID passed by parameter does not match any ID in the light bulb list
      AlreadyOffException - if the light bulb is already on

    • printBulbs

      public void printBulbs()
      Prints on standard output the information of every light bulb in the array.

    • obtainLightBulb

      public LightBulb obtainLightBulb​(java.lang.String ID) throws UnknownIdentifierException
      Returns the light bulb with the ID passed by parameter
      Parameters:
      ID - lightbulb identifier
      Returns:
      the light bulb that matches the ID passed by parameter
      Throws:
      UnknownIdentifierException - if the ID passed by parameter does not match any ID in the light bulb list

    • currentConsumption

      public double currentConsumption()
      Returns the sum of energy consumption of all the light bulbs in the building.
      Returns:
      the sum of energy consumption of all the light bulbs in the building

    • maximumConsumption

      public double maximumConsumption()
      Returns the sum of maximum energy consumption of all light bulbs in the building by turning on every light bulb.
      Returns:
      the sum of maximum energy consumption of all light bulbs in the building

    • addLightBulb

      public void addLightBulb​(LightBulb lightbulb)
      Adds the light bulb passed by parameter to the light bulb list.
      Parameters:
      lightbulb - the light bulb that is going to be added to the light bulb list

    • sort

      public void sort()
      Sorts the light bulb list by bulb identifier.

    • printWetPlaceBulbs

      public void printWetPlaceBulbs()
      Prints every light bulb that can be placed in wet places.
